classified_components.reasoning: Muffler is a component designed to reduce exhaust noise in internal combustion engine vehicles. Electric vehicles do not produce exhaust noises, so mufflers are not necessary.
Catalytic converter is fundamentally tied to combustion engines as it converts harmful exhaust gases from the internal combustion engine into less toxic emissions.
Exhaust Manifold is fundamentally tied to combustion engines for directing exhaust gases from multiple cylinders to a single pipe before entering the exhaust system.
A tailpipe is an integral part of vehicles powered by internal combustion engines (ICE) for the expulsion of exhaust gases.
